definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: Pretentious has always been the subject of frequent combat is certainly a reason.
sentences.chinese: 总是孤芳自赏却屡受冲击肯定是有缘故原由的。

sentences.english: If nobody appreciate you, you still can be narcissistic.
sentences.chinese: 全世界都没人欣赏，自己依然可以孤芳自赏。

sentences.english: Rolled with the whitecaps, gurgling sound of water, secluded orchid in a deserted Valley, indulge in self-admiration.
sentences.chinese: 翻卷着的白浪，淙淙的流水声，空谷幽兰，孤芳自赏。

sentences.english: I don’t think I’m alone in this.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我并非孤芳自赏。

sentences.english: Perhaps film suits him better than fine arts, which are more introspective and self-absorbed.
sentences.chinese: 或许，对于孤芳自赏的美术来说，电影更适合他。

definition: lit. looking at one's shadow and feeling sorry for oneself (idiom)/fig. alone and dejected
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
to cater to the public's taste/kitsch/commercial
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
